text:
Food is pretty good, not gonna lie. BUT you have to make sacrifices if you choose to eat there. It literally takes an hour to an hour and a half to deliver food. Seriously. EVERY SINGLE TIME. Doesnt matter if we order at 8am, 10am or 1pm. Never fails, they take F-O-R-E-V-E-R. If you dont get what you ordered or you are upset by them delivering your breakfast around LUNCH time, be ready to have the owner talk down to you and be a total bitch to you for i dont know, just wanting what you pay for?! 

Its over priced. But its decently tasteful food. Takes forever. Owners a witch. And i'm pretty sure that they continuing forget to pack my extra ranch just to piss me off. 

End Rant. 

PS- I've never gone in there to eat because i frankly, i'd rather tip the nice delivery driver then the ignorant imbeciles that work in the dining area. 

PPS- My hot chocolate today was cold. They should call it Cold Chocolate. Or start caring if their hot chocolate is hot. One of the two would be great!

This is my favorite spot to go and chill with my friends after church. The food is always good, especially the specialty french toasts. The employees are very friendly and the prices are very reasonable. Swing by and give this gem a chance. You won't be disappointed.
Not a fan.  I am a huge breakfast fan and the food here is so so, at best.   Don't waste your money.

Eeew!  This place is horrible.  I am shocked to see so many positive reviews.  I feel like it's the brain child of a guy who decided to open a beach-themed eatery without considering the decor, the food, or the service.  Understaffed and uninspired.  Located in a strip mall off Jones and the decor inside is bland, at best.  Tables are tiny, the chairs wobble, the whole place feels super cheesy.  The service is the slowest I have ever experienced in my life, and possibly the least friendly.  The menu is very plain- just the usual egg dishes, nothing made from scratch or in house.  With so many great breakfast places in town, I am not sure why anyone would chose to eat here.  It is no cheaper than anywhere else and is nowhere near as good as Egg Works, Baby Stacks, Crepe Expectations, etc.  I like to support local businesses but this place blows.  Skip it, or you'll wish you had.

AWFUL!!! I placed on order online and it took forever for them to make a BLT sandwich and it's supposed to come with fries, like the first time I ordered there, but this time i got some crappy chowder!!! The one waitress was off flirting with the owner or manager instead of doing her job. All the other workers were just aimlessly walking  around and didn't see anyone cooking.

HOW in the world is this place still open? 

Never have I experienced such an awkward and uncomfortable dining experience. The rudeness and lack of customer service that was grossly displayed by the waitstaff left me with a taste in my mouth so sour that I had to write a review and warn others. 

I've tried Beach Cafe a total of three times. The first time, service was bad and the food wasn't much better. Second time, I walked in to get take out....and twenty five minutes later my sandwich was prepared. I, stupidly, decided to give this place ONE more chance (a year later) because of the close location to both my home and my work. 

My colleague and I walked in to a COMPLETELY EMPTY restaurant where we waited for a server to come to our table for SIX MINUTES. Six minutes of us awkwardly waiting in the middle of an empty dining area while the four workers, including who I assume is the manager, all talking, laughing, and gossiping along with staring at us but never making any acknowledgement towards our presence. I have managed several successful hotel and restaurant chains for over twenty years, so I understand that while customer service always comes first, with high volume and overcapacity issues, sometimes it takes a little while to get to everyone.  I have had instances where everyone of my tables was filled with people waiting around the block, and every single one of my servers made sure everyone was greeted promptly and taken care of. 

WHAT IN THE WORLD is the excuse for such behavior when there is no other customers in the place? 

I was truly baffled. 

Finally, I politely walked up and asked "I'm sorry, do we order at the front" to which a heavy set lady rudely responded "uh, someone will come to you"

Alright, here we go. Finally a young lady walked over to the table and said "what are you getting?" 

That was her exact words. 

I need to remind you all that she was doing absolutely nothing but gossiping with the others while we waited to even order a drink. 

We ended up walking out absolutely disgusted by the lack of customer service. 

This place should be shut down and the manager running this establishment should be ashamed of herself.  I would love to contact whoever the manager is personally and explain it to them, but from the sounds of the reviews, I think I know who the manager is they're describing and considering she was one of the "waitstaff" that was rudely staring at us instead of being a server, I don't think the conversation would get too far.

I love the food! I love the staff! I'm from San Diego and I come here to get my taste of paradise and beach setting. The owner is the best! During holidays there's always something exciting on the menu!

Not only does beach cafe have great food, but the people are awesome too. There are so many breakfast items on the menu from breakfast quesadillas, burritos, sandwiches, sliders. Place is awesome. Please go. Friendly establishment and good food!

Food with a side of the owners offensive social & political rantings.  
Food is ok, but sit outside or you will be the unwilling audience of the owner.  She loudly answers questions no one asked and explains all that she feels is wrong with the world.  Sadly, all I wanted was lunch.

Perhaps the best way to describe this place is consistent... consistently BAD. I have been in the somewhat unique, albeit unenviable, position to have sampled a large variety of their lunch items. From their fish tacos to burgers to various chicken and deli sandwiches, corn chowder, and smoothies, I have yet to discover something that is at least half-decent.

Perhaps, more specifics are in order. The fried fish had a cold, thick, and dried-out texture of cardboard. The greasy burgers were overcooked and had a soggy bun. The chicken is dry, lacking in flavor, and smothered with oily cheese. The corn chowder is a nasty gelatinous goo. The smoothies are extremely sweet and not as thick as they ought to be. You get the idea...  

Why would I continue to subject myself to such awful food? One of the facilities, where I work, will order lunch for us from various places if we are working through the lunch hour. I'm not completely sure who is responsible for picking the place each time, but there must be some kind of kickbacks taking place because I cannot fathom why they seem to keep picking this place over a vastly superior alternative like Tropical Smoothie Cafe.

One time, when they asked me what I wanted to order, I told them that I would pass. However, this woman felt really bad and insisted on suggesting something that I would like. I ended up ordering some sort of chicken sandwich which was, surprise surprise, terrible. The most recent time they ordered from here, to avoid hurting anyone's feelings, I just ordered some random sandwich. I took it with me when I left the facility but dumped it in the nearest trash bin. I felt bad wasting "food" and for a moment thought that maybe I should give it to some homeless person. Then again, if I had, they might think that I was trying to poison them.

They have literally the best burgers in town. I'm talking better than cheeburger, In and Out, whoever you love the best, these burgers are better!!

They are also really awesome people and all for the community!

Plus it's a great deal for the neighborhood!

This place is a great local cafe hidden on the SW side of town. They have an extensive menu with both healthy salads and wraps for those needing something healthy for lunch or an extensive list of tasty burgers/sandwiches. A big plus for many is this place does delivery through online orders. Make sure to call to see what the daily specials are also. 

Things I have tried and love:

Cancun Chicken Salad
Coronado Chicken Salad
All three of the wraps
Maui melt burger & Waikiki Teriyaki Burger.
Chicken Strips.
Smoothies++

This place has a silly Hawaii beach cafe theme going on (they even sell swimsuits off a rack by the front door?) and a bar counter to sit at in addition to normal table seating.

I have been there several times over the course of a year.  Every time I have gone it has been wonderful.  The mushroom burger is so good.  And also the veggie burger.  Service is always so friendly.  Love this neighborhood place.

Never had bad food from this place in fact I've only ever had food that great or amazing from this place. Delivery is quick and cheap the restaurant it's self is a nice place to eat either way that you get your food it's amazing. My only complaint is that they aren't open later than 4. They're burgers are amazing is all their breakfast food.

A Hawaiian themed beach restaurant here. It's a laid-back atmosphere in a strip mall area right near my house. I do like the decor. It kind of makes me feel I am somewhat at a beach. I usually run into Robin as my server. She's a nice young girl who is quick with recommendations if I'm not sure what I really want to eat. So far I've had the Monterey chicken sandwich, the Frisco Burger, teriyaki burger, and quite a few other sandwiches on the menu. I don't think I had a meal that I did not enjoy there. The prices are very affordable.

Beware.... The poor reviews for this place mainly come from the shotty customer service and so far they are living up to expectations... I've lived close to this restaurant for a few years now and have yet to try it due to the reviews but decided to go for it this morning. 

I was searching on yelp for some delivery and this place popped up. Yelp offered the option to place the order on my iPhone app so I went ahead and ordered. I was able to place the order very easily and it have me a window of about 45min to an hour which I was fine with. Since this place is right around the corner from me I did follow up after an hour had passed just to check on the status. I was less concerned with the time and just wanted to make sure the order went through since I haven't ordered on my yelp app yet. 

I was greeted by a women on the other line who must have been having a bad day. I don't even think I was greeted with a hi or hello... Just beach cafe. I informed the women I ordered on yelp and wanted to see if everything went through, and when I could expect it. She began to tell me I couldn't have done that because they don't offer it... Well if your reading this review you well know there is an option for placing an order. I politely told her there was an option and I ordered a few items and have already been charged for it. She continued to tell me I was wrong in a rude tone and then asked where I lived to which she mentioned someone just left to deliver it. I thanked her for checking and also told her she should take a look on yelp to see the option offered since it got them business. 

When the delivery guy came I showed him the yelp app with the delivery option and informed him of my experience with the women on the phone. He apologized and the only thing I do feel bad about is I wish I would have given him a bigger tip than what I left originally but the women really bothered me with her rude/condescending tone. You would think after so many similar poor reviews these people might make an effort to change their ways. 

Overall the good was good and I would like to give this place another shot and re-review at a later date to see if maybe I just caught this place on a bad day....

I work locally to Beach Cafe and myself and entire office frequently orders from here. Food Good workers good owner TERRIBLE! Julie or Jane whoever is ratchet. Never had a problem with the service until i ordered on line thru their third party ordering site, the order was wrong I don't eat meat, meat came. Total Complete wrong order. I called and explained about the mix up the lady said well call eat247 (the site they use to take on-line orders) and get a refund from them! she was completely rude saying that she isn't in the business of giving free food!! the nerve! a mistake on an order is simple remake and keep your customers.. not only was she rude and vicious i mean vicious, she proceeded to say that if i wrote a bad review on-line she would call my Boss at Hilton and get me fired.. she stated the last person who had a problem here she got fired!!the owner told me that!!!! i was completely flabbergasted!!! i couldn't believe the ignorance and sheer disgusting way that the owner of Beach Cafe talked to a regular paying customer.. Beach Cafe wont get any future business From Hilton if I can help it.. I write this review to say no business owner should ever under any circumstances talk this way and say these things to a paying customer..a bad day?? it was 8:30am!!! I wouldn't support this business..She needs serious etiquette classes in dealing with people and she should be completely ashamed of herself for threatening to have someone fired from their job for writing a bad review...!!!!SHAME ON YOU JULIE JANE OR WHATEVER YOUR NAME IS HILTON IS A WONDERFUL COMPANY TO WORK FOR AND WOULD NEVER LISTEN TO A DISRESPECTFUL MAD WOMAN LIKE THE OWNER OF BEACH CAFE!!!!!!!! I AM STARTING THE SOUTHWEST BOYCOTT OF BEACH CAFE!!!!!!!!
If you're looking for a great breakfast place this is the place to go. Their French toast and sunset scramble is the best breakfast combo! Definitely a place to check out

yes its nice to have a restaurant that's not a part of a chain but the price should not be the same in the strip. this is rediculous place. the price of the food is like a tourist price. their waffle is $5.75 thats only a simple waffle. if you go to denny's you can have a complete breakfast  for that price. this is a no no no place to go. i will not recommend this place to anybody.

If you have lived in Las Vegas long you know trying to find a breakfast spot on a Sunday morning without a thirty minute wait is near impossible. Wait no longer, this amazing breakfast spot has little to no wait and amazing food too! I literally eat here Three Sunday's a month and the owner is so kind to us and our boys. My wife gets the tamales every time and is always satisfied! They have some great specials and you can't go wrong with the captain crunch French toast!

Tried the Beach Cafe for brunch today.  Nice atmosphere, very "islandy" feel.  Plenty of breakfast options as well as sandwiches and burgers.

Our group had a club sandwich, a chicken sandwich with chili peppers on it, surfs up scramble and pancakes.  Everything was good, the fries were crisp and came with a great side of ranch.  The portions were large and the service was good as well.

I have another breakfast option on the list!
I love supporting local businesses. They have great breakfasts & lunches. Love their turkey burgers and frozen mocha.

Beach Cafe,

What has happened to you my friend? I remember coming in here and the service was good. Your food use to taste better, now I feel like I'm eating nuked potatoes with my breakfast. My mouth goes dry from the tater, my cup no longer overflows with refills. Instead you let me go the whole meal without a refill to teach me a lesson!. I use to love you but I'm removing your stars! I am hoping that my next experience will be much more pleasant because you do have potential & once were great. Your menu is awesome but your service sucks. 

Sincerely,
Me

We got here about 7:30, they had been open a half hour and we were their first customer. Even then, it took the waitress 10 minutes to get to our table. The place is small, she was working at the counter about 10 feet away, so she couldn't miss us, but it looked like her "mornng routine" was not to be interupted, so we waited.  We ordered right away, I had eggs benedict and the kids had pancakes. It took about 15 minutes for the food to come out.  The food wasn't bad, wasn't great, either.  Nothing at all remarkable. 

The reason I'm giving 2 stars is because of the service. The waitress was not friendly, she didn't come back to our table at all after she brought our food. We waited 15 minutes after we were done eating for our check, I finally asked my grandson to go ask the waitress for it (at this point, its 8:15 and we're still the only diners). He stood at the counter and she ignored him, finally looking at me like "what does he want"? I told her we needed our check. When I went to pay, the woman at the register was talking to a guy at the counter who had just come in. They chatted for a few moments about his new apartment and she finally walked over to ring me up.  As she was doing that, the phone rang, she answered it, and then stopped checking me out to take a phone order, as I stood there. and waited. and waited. and waited.  I was finally rung up and we were out of there by 8:30.

Its pretty obvious this place makes their breakfast business on takeout orders. Walk in customers are secondary.  The food wasn't bad, and if it weren't for the service, I'd consider going back, but I'm not spending my money for mediocore food when the service is so lousy.

The Chilli cheese scramble was excellent!  The Chilli was delicious and the potatoes were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Perfect. Also the best pumpkin bread I've ever had. Served warm and toasted!

The food is good but the owner is not really nice.  I have come in here plenty of times and she doesn't greet you or anything. I walked in today and she looked at me and didn't acknowledge the fact that I was there. Her cook said hi to me. Like I said the food is good, but they seem like they don't care to have my business so I would much rather go somewhere else.

Ok - I'm finally getting around to writing this review about 8 months after we stopped there. It made such a sweet impression that I just have to write. We were driving around and looking for a place to have brunch. We saw this place and took a chance. It didn't look like much from the outside, but inside - it was really cute! There are bikinis hanging from the ceiling, and everything is decorated in a 'beach style'. 
We talked to the server about our next stop - Reno - and she wrote down a list of places to go for dinner, as well as suggestions for things to see. We'll definitely stop by here on our next trip to Las Vegas, even if it's a little out of the way. Very family-oriented. 
Love ya!
Really great fresh food.  Odd location, but very tasty.  Turkey sandwich was on the softest bread from a local bakery.

The food was good. The restaurant has Cool and hip atmosphere with beach vibes. There were swimsuits hanging from the ceiling everywhere lol.

Service was nice as well. My mom loved her Asian Salad a lot.

I have been going to the beach for several years.  Definitely a neighborhood spot.  You very quickly get to know the staff so it feels like a visit with friends.  It is a very family friendly place with good food.

Ate lunch at Beach Cafe yesterday. I had the Beach Club sandwich, which was the best I have had in my life! Could only eat 1/2 as it is pretty big. One thing I liked about it was that it was grilled on sourdough bread on the flat top instead of toasting the bread. It was cut in half instead of the silly 4 triangles. My wife had the San Francisco burger which she liked but thought it was a little greasy. It is a burger on grilled sourdough w/ avacodo, bacon, and swiss cheese. The homemade chili was very good also. The staff was very friendly, the decor has a casual Hawaii theme. The prices are good and the place is clean. I am going to try breakfast there this weekend.

It was a nice little cafe that I would recommend to others. The server was super nice and the food was good. I'm not sure why other people are ranting, it's not a five star restaurant. It's a local cafe which is ALWAYS better than some chain restaurant. I will definitely go back.
Horrible! I got the Thai chicken wrap and it's 90% fried noodles inside. The corn chowder is weird and they got my coffee order wrong. What a waste of my money!

Great little cafe, location kind of sucks but worth finding if your close to 215 and Jones. 

I've eaten there several times and not only is the food great and worth the price but also the staff are friendly and fun. The Cafe also does catering and i had them cater an event for me, Everyone in the office that I bought lunch for loved the food and they ended up ordering again from them. 

Overall the staff and food are great ts nice to get that personal service in this day and age. 

Try the Burgers :)

Great little cafe hidden away in a strip mall.  Coworkers and i come here for lunch every so often, as they have great burgers and lunch specials most of the time.  

Some of the more memorable lunch specials are:

-Ranch BLT (more like bacon and bread burger, but tasty ranch mayo)
-Bacon grilled cheese with tomato soup
-Cuban sandwich

But my favorite thing to get here is the Ortega burger.  The tangy green chilies and the melted cheese is a great combination with the toasted buns.  Burger is usually cooked to perfection, and the fries are always fresh and piping hot.  Get it with a side of ranch and you got yourself an awesome lunch.  

Friendly staff and usually open seating as not many folks know about this place.  Go check it out!
Only ever gotten delivery but the food is great! Delivery is fast and have yet to find an item I didn't like. Always get the chili it's bomb.
Always enjoy going here.. The staff is very nice. I usually just have lunch.. But today I ate here for breakfast and it was delicious

I'm writing this review for my 91-year-old mother. This is her favorite restaurant. We drive about 10 miles just to eat here. The food is always good, the servers friendly and helpful, and the owner is almost always there. I've had most everything on the menu, but I usually get the daily specials--they are tasty and plentiful. My mother's favorite is the waffles; they are cooked to a perfect golden brown and served with butter and syrup. For lunch she usually gets a hamburger, but the salads and sandwiches are also good.

Small little restaurant.  I have driven past it on numerous occassions, kind of unsure about it.  I went in this weekend for breakfast and I sure am glad I did.  It was a small little place, but we were immediately welcomed with friendly smiles from the entire staff.  Everybody was extremely pleasant and cracked a few jokes here and there.  The menu was bigger then I had expected, and a lot of the menu items looked really good.  I ordered a breakfast scramble with potatoes and a smoothie.  I thoroughly enjoyed the meal.  It tasted like a breakfast I would make at home.  It all tasted very fresh and the potatoes were deeeee-lish.  They had a little sitting area outside and I am very excited to come back with the dogs and have a nice breakfast outside.  I'm a fan!
Love this place. Friendly service and finally a place in LV that knows how to make a great burger and a great pastrami sandwich. Love the krinkle fries.
I love Breakfast and coffee here.  nice people very friendly. it great place for breakfast and lunch.

From the server saying "b***h" in front of me (not directly at me) and getting my order late, this place needs to redefine their entire service. The AC is not working and feels gross to be in. Would not come back.

I was around this neighborhood early this morning because of an appointment.  I woke up late so I could not eat any breakfast (my most important meal of the day).  Walking around nearly 1 1/2 hours with empty stomach, I was starving by the time I was finished with my business!  So I looked up a breakfast & brunch in the area. 

I had several choices:  Baby-Stacks, Egg works, Cracked Egg, Daily Egg, etc.  But I chose this location because I have tried Baby Stacks and Egg Works; and I figured Cracked Egg and Daily Egg would be very similar to Egg Works.  So I decided to try this place.

I ordered Surfs Up Veggie Scramble and Cappuccino....  I ate the whole thing, but I would not say that it was good.  I mean. I was definitely hungry and so I ate.  Usually when I'm hungry, I feel like the food tastes better... However, I just thought I should eat because I'm hungry... 

The cappuccino was a little luke-warm and not hot enough.  The roasted potatoes(?) were decent but the scrambled egg (the main dish) was a little bland and too oily.  Adding ketchup to it helped the bland flavor.

The service was very casual and I'm not complaining.  It is a casual dining place, and I do not expect much.  I cannot say that the staff is friendly though... The server did her job definitely.  She wasn't mean or rude.  She just did her job. So I would just a smile would have been nicer.  

I am not sure if I will go back.  I mean, if I am in the neighborhood again, I would probably hit up another breakfast cafe to try.  However, I wouldn't mind eating here again and trying one of their burgers and smoothies... IF this is the closest location.
Love this place! Friendly staff and GREAT food! My husband and I really liked the atmosphere - nice and quaint cafe. I loved their special banana French toast!

Beach Cafe, what can I say (haha that rhymed). I have always been weary of trying new places, I mean I love doing it but at the same time you're always scared it's a miss. But considering it was in walking distance and I was in Vegas this is the place to try new places. Me and my friend walked to here and from the get go it's a nice little cafe. Plenty of seating, and everyone is pretty friendly. There menu is nice, I mean I wish they were in Cali where the beaches are. It makes me kind of sad cause honestly it beats out the one breakfast/lunch place we have here. But at least it gives me somewhere to look forward too when I come back. Me and my friend ended up coming six days out of the seven days we were here. I ended up mainly getting the cafe breakfast with a bagel and bacon. And their iced coffee. I'll admit the first few times it was kind of watered down, but it did its job and it's free refills. Their sun kissed iced tea is yummy and sweet too. I did have their bbq bacon cheeseburger and fries and they were good too. I mean I wish I had tried more variety but I'm kind of a plain jane kind of guy. The cafe breakfast ended up being my go to, and I'm not a huge breakfast person. They also have specials here and there. They had a captain crunch French toast that was to die for . The prices were fair, I usually ended up paying about 10 for my food and drink. On top of it if you're the type to frequent this place. Ask for a meal card you get a free meal after about I believe 10 or 12 meals. But hey, free food is always good.
Stopped by for breakfast before leaving vegas. The food was incredible and the entire staff was hilarious. I loved it here!

Found out about this place on www.misterfreakfast.com which is our go-to source for breakfast anywhere in the country.  The breakfast here was fine.  I had an omelet and my wife had the breakfast croissant sandwich.  Both were very tasty!.  The service was great  and the food was delivered in a timely manor... but then there were only about 5 customers in the place at 8:30AM... must be an early crowd in this neighborhood.

Ambiance? nothing special...  Its just a diner. Corrugated galvanized metal.  Go here for the food and call it good.

The food is always great and fresh! I love the specials, the atmosphere and the service! Robyn is the BEST (Asian waitress) and she always remembers my drink order and never gets my food wrong. My husband and I only come here when Robyn is working because we know we will have a great experience. We come literally every weekend! (Also have multiple friends that do as well)

The food here is good, prices are affordable, and the location is close to my house. Only downside is that the service is almost always slow. You're not greeted when you walk in, so you sort of have to awkwardly stand there until you get an employee's attention. It takes a while to get your food and your check. The employees are nice, but definitely expect to do some waiting.

I really love beach cafe. I order from here all of the time. Mostly because my lunch is at 9:15 in the morning and they will deliver lunch items to my door. Well my office door.
I normally get the Asian salad Or the asian wrap .. complete deliciousness.  
But my favorite is the french dip that they serve, they serve it with french fries. But I like their fruit cup, and their passion iced tea too. 
Honestly I have not had a bad meal from Beach Cafe and their customer service is always top notch.

What a great little hidden treasure this cafe is. I'm so glad it has gained a following, even being tucked away in a random strip mall. I remember when it opened! Sigh. They grow up so fast. 

Great lunch spot and wonderful variety so everyone in your group can be accommodated. The staff is super attentive and geniunely seem happy you stopped in. I've eaten here with friends, family and alone and have always gotten the same great service. The hamburgers are great if you want to gorge yourself, they're big and come with lots of fries! Crinkle fries by the way, and they're legit. I love the Cali beach theme menu items, the fish tacos are great and fresh and the salads are big and crunchy. Lots of wraps to choose from, the Thai one is really tasty. The smoothies weren't my fave, a little heavy on ice, but I guess it depends on how you like your smoothie. I prefer more fruit and yogurt.

The decor is really cute too, bathing suits hanging everywhere. They take the beach theme seriously. Overall a great lunch spot if you're in the area!

This place is a great local breakfast place to go to. They have a nice menu and I love their smoothies!! They offer delivery which is nice because I live so close. The people are friendly that work there and it just has a very nice welcoming and comfortable feel to it.

This place is perfect to go to on a lazy Sunday morning- very casual and low key beach decor, with a lot of options on the menu.
The food is good- I've only been there for breakfast, so there isn't much you can say about eggs, no matter how they are cooked. I once tried the eggs benedict sliders, which were a little bland, but I usually get one of the scrambles or a croissant sandwich, which are great. The portions are big too, with lots of buttery toast or homefries, and it doesn't take very long to get your food.
The service is always wonderful. Drinks get refilled quickly, and substituting veggies or fruit for my homefries is no big deal. I am not a regular, but the woman working there is always very friendly and provides service with a smile.

What a great local joint on the southwest.  I've gotten carry out twice and my wife and i finally sat down to eat today.  All the food I've had so far has been great...turkey rueben, monterey chicken sandwich, breakfast.  The place is clean and the staff is very nice.  If I had to pick on anything; the biscuits and gravy weren't very hot.  It's nice to have a non-chain in the neighborhood that is reliably good.  We'll be back!

NEGATIVES
-service slow 
-food very mediocre
-owner badmouthed customers that had just left

POSITIVES
-smelt like chocolate

I can't get enough of Beach Cafe. 

I always order their food for lunch while I am at work, and I am never disappointed. 

Beach Cafe definitely has the best Corn Chowder I have ever had. It is so creamy, with big chunks of chicken, sausage, peppers, corn. 

They also have an amazing Southwest Chicken Salad, served with a tortilla on the bottom. 

I have ordered several items off their menu, and shockingly for me they have the best frappachino's too! They are made with ICE CREAM = yum, especially on these hot Vegas days. 

I would highly recommend going there at least once. I have never eaten in the restaurant I always order the food to go, and they have offer free delivery service which is very convenient. 

There service is a little slow, it usually takes me about an hour to get my food, so I always order it prior to my lunch. I have never had any problems with the staff as far as customer service, but honestly the Corn Chowder is amazing that I will wait any day for it.

Beach Cafe saved my life.   After partying for a good 48 hours non stop it was nice to put a little something in my system.  I chose the sausage egg  in an English muffin with a side of bacon.  I ate as quickly as I could and then tried to pass out just as fast.  It worked!  Basically, it's a Denny's on Wheels!  (Thanks Sabrina L.)

I slept for a good hour or two until I woke up parched.

Ordered the Malibu Turkey Sandwich that came with fruit on the side. Sandwich wasn't bad, but for the price I paid ($7.75 before tax) I was expecting a lot more food or something spectacular, like Capriotti's. The bread was good and so was the fruit, but I don't think I'd order it again...I could make it myself for way cheaper.
Maybe their breakfast food is better...

My friend wanted to try this place so we came for breakfast one morning. The hot cocoa was delish! Looked more like a dessert. I had the tamale and eggs breakfast. It wasn't that great. I should have ordered the blueberry pancakes which I first chose but then changed my mind. Sorry, cant remember what my friend ordered but she wasn't too impressed with whatever she had. Her daughter had the french toast which looked really good and a huge portion. She liked it. I should have stolen a piece to try it. Oh well. I'll pass on coming back here unless I feel like some of that hot cocoa!
Love the food and service here.. Rocky and Robyn are always very polite and the food as good as the atmosphere.. Highly recommend stopping by if you have not already ..

One of the best breakfast places I have been to in a very long time. Open for breakfast And lunch but so worth getting up early. Have my favorite big island scramble with massive fresh home fries. I suggest getting a side of the out of this world blueberry pancakes. The are fluffy and packed with blueberry and the flavor actually reminds me of birthday cake. Thumbs up beach cafe, thank you for feeding me on my way to a 14 hours shift!!

Unfortunately since my last review the food quality has gone a little downhill. On my last visit , my wife and I came in for our favorites a stack of blueberry pancakes and my island scramble and for her the Hawaiian burger with grilled pineapple and teriyaki sauce. This time around my scamble was missing the flavors that I became accustomed to. It was pretty bland so I skipped ahead to my favorite pancakes. I was very upset when my light fluffy delicious cakes ended up being wayyyyy too sweet and were crunchy. As for my wife's burger , it was over cooked the pineapple was soggy and they forgot the teriyaki sauce. As they did bring her a side of sauce, it ended up being extremely salty. I have never tasted a teriyaki sauce so salty and yet so thin. It ran and tasted more like a soy sauce with a sugar packet dropped in it. I want to give it another chance , but paying $40 for two meals that were hardly edible. Not going to happen anytime soon.

I love the place because the food is overall pretty good and so are the prices but the delivery service isn't great at all. They've messed up my order a couple of times and I've overlooked it because the food was pretty good and usually something really similar but today I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and somehow got a grilled cheese? Not to mention the fries were terribly soggy. Won't be ordering delivery again soon

I literally haven't had anything here that wasn't amazing. The biggest problem I have here is deciding what to eat because everything is so good! The food is very fresh and unique. Omg! The chicken salad blt is mind blowing. Their pasta salad is perfect. The list goes on and on. Highly recommend!
Had perfectly done eggs w/ potatoes & fruit. All were excellent as was the service. The box lunches are my favorite! Great place to dine in as well.

I have been going to Beach Cafe for many years.  It is down the street from my children's schools (Canarelli Middle and Tony Alamo Elementary).  Every time I have ordered take out, it was fast, hot, and delicious, not to mention, my orders have always been correct.  I recommend this place for breakfast and lunch.  And I just learned they do catering!  Excited to have them do my next office event.

Friendly service, great food.  
Good sized servings. Fun atmosphere. 
Good music.  
Always a good crowd of locals.... A good sign
Sometimes a little wait at lunch time as they do a huge delivery/catering business too.
Just another sign of how popular they are!

I always order breakfast delivery from this place..  Breakfast burrito, Eggs Benedict, french toast, and the breakfast sliders are awesome.  If only they offered stamp cards on delivery service, I would have a free meal by now...
Great food. Love the delivery service and pay option through yelp app. Food arrived before scheduled delivery time hot and perfect. My go to breakfast spot.

Food was okay. Service was very slow. Couldn't tell staff apart from customers as there were people hanging out at counter chatting while eating food and same people were going behind the counter leaving the impression they work there as well. Had to ask for service when we noticed nobody was coming over to take our order after waiting for about 15 minutes. Food also took awhile to get. Last time I eat here.

Hidden gem!!! I had never heard of this place but stumbled across it via yelp. Came on a Sunday morning, and were taken care of immediately. The inside is decorated really cute & beachy. Our server was so friendly and really took the time to explain the menu and catering/delivery options. I ordered a 2 egg breakfast and it was amazing. The potatoes were my favorite - they were red potatoes and had a garlic taste. The toast and eggs were also good. I will definitely return!

I've had breakfast at this cafe a few times and every time I've walked in, the service has been amazing. The prices are reasonable and the portions are a good size. The menu has many options down to their coffee drinks. I love their chai tea latte!

Extremely slow service especially when there was only 4 other tables. Took the server 5 minutes to come to the table to get our drink order and realized after we stared at her and didn't answer that we didn't have menus. Also took 30 minutes to get our two meals. Which was a breakfast quesadilla and a scramble. Didn't refill our drinks. There were also kids running around behind the counter. Try somewhere else for breakfast if you're looking in the area.
I've only had delivery but everything else always perfect. It tastes way better and is healthier than anywhere else I can get delivered.

Beach Cafe is a hidden gem in the Southwest part of town. The food is always good (love the BLT and the chicken fringers...and the fries are the best!!). The service is great, the place is clean and nicely decorated. Best part has to be that they also deliver!!! I get delivery from here about once a week and they are very quick and the food is just as good delivered as it is eaten there.

I guess if  I had to find a negative it would be that their smoothies (while very yummy) are a little too expensive.

Hope this place sticks around for awhile! (It should because I have told everyone I work with that lives in the area to check it out and they all love it too!)

I read the reviews before coming to beach cafe for the first time.  Perhaps my expectations were too high...

I arrived Sunday morning about 9 a.m.  Only one other patron
was there.  I ordered the "big island scramble" for $8.95.  I found
the potatoes good, but the egg scramble tasted very bland.  Even
the english muffin was bland.  The cook puts these itsy bitsy pieces
of bacon, ham and sausage in the scramble.  You might need a
magnifying glass to find them.  Even the cheese was cheap.  No
taste.  The waitress twice asked if I liked it, but I think she could
tell by my face that I didn't.  I told her my scramble needed some
pineapple chunks to spruce it up.  She offered a "side" of pineapple...
for extra money of course!  I declined.  I don't mind spending $10
for breakfast when it is good.  This breakfast was not good.  Plus
it took at least 15 minutes to get my meal.  Much too long! 

The pleasant waitress brought me the water I asked for.  But it wasn't
until I was ready for the check did she offer a refill.  Moreover, the lemon
wedges for the water were tart and sour.

Maybe the sandwiches at beach cafe are better?  Doubt that I will
return to find out!

Best place in Vegas! From salads to the tastiest sandwiches and hamburgers... Definitely a local favorite! Monterey Chicken sandwich = Must have! Great prices. Reminds me of a Saved by the Bell diner hang out joint... Owners r cool as Sh@!%# too

I live nearby and go here pretty often.  I've always had excellent service and very tasty food, no matter what I order or what time of day I go in.  I love the casual environment and the relaxing music that's always playing.  I've never tried anything from the breakfast menu, but all of their sandwiches and burgers are top notch in taste and quality and come in really generous portions.  Their smoothies are yummy too.  Yes, they're made from a mix, but they're good, so who cares.  

Just because a place offers smoothies and has "cafe" in the name, doesn't mean it's a health food place.  I think people are being way too picky in their expectations.  This place is a local gem!

Has a California beachfront feel to the restaurant. From swimming trunks and bikini's hang from ceiling, to the surfboards hanging on the walls. Very friendly staff and the food is good, a bit pricey but good.
Best Breakfast place in Las Vegas!  Food is consistently good and Staff are always friendly and prompt.   I also like their Stamp card , 10 stamps gets you a free breakfast!

Ordered take out for breakfast. I got everything I asked for (extra blueberries in my pancakes, sub Swiss and egg whites in my omelette). When I got home, I really, really enjoyed my meal. It was less expensive and not obnoxiously huge like Egg Works. Great job!

Called this morning and ordered food to be delivered. 20 minutes after my order was supposed to be delivered, I called and was told that my order was never even made!!! No apologies or complimentary service was even ordered. Bad form folks...

Lunch was nothing special. We got there at 10:30am with full intent of eating breakfast (already had it picked out). We were quoted 15-20minutes. At 11:10am the host looks over at us and asks what our name is (after already seating about 4-6 groups who had come in after us), she sends us down with the lunch menu. I ask if something happened and why we had been waiting for 40min. I was told "I don't think it was that long." After ordering and waiting for longer than normal our food arrived. The French toast was good but nothing special and the fish and chips were soggy. Spoke to the manager who took off the fish and chips from our bill. Nice of him but it was already a bad experience and not great food.

I am from Chicago and needed food delivered to me so I called Beach Cafe. They are open at 7am and are ready for breakfast.

Food:
 I ordered a salad, a wrap, egg salad sandwich, 2 smoothies, and a coffee. The salad was huge but had a lot of romaine hearts which made it hard to eat so I picked apart the salad and what was left was amazing. The asian wrap was great and it came with fresh fruit which tasted delicious. The 2 smoothies, Wipe Out and Jamaican Me Crazy, were right on key! The coffee could have been fresher.

Service:
The food took about and hour to get here and they gave no warning it would take that long. 

Definitely will order again while I'm in town.

The food here is fantastic, don't let the location scare you away! It's in a strip mall behind a gas station, but it's a hidden gem. The owner and workers have a sarcastic sense of humor, which can be off-putting to those that don't know them. They are truly wonderful people. The food takes awhile, so don't go here if you're in a hurry. They also do takeout, which we use all the time.

We went here for breakfast. The food came out very slowly due to them having a large catering order right before us.  The customer service was friendly and we were at least updated on how the progress was going with our food.  When we got the food it was pretty good.  My husband and I shared French toast with strawberries and whipped cream and it was just what I was craving.  I also had the Cali Bene which is a different take on eggs Benedict that adds tomato, avocado and spinach to the classic dish.  It came with home fries which were also good.  I would definitely eat here again.

A little overpriced for the "ValueForMoney" digs. but hey, its 24 hours man. Inside the depths of Hotel Tropicana, it sure is a good visit. Vegetarian friendly. If you're staying at the tropicana, this is a no brainer at nights. go get it.

This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas!
Definitely a must try for those of us who like to eat out frequently. 

The staff is always amazing and the decorations are pretty neat.
You will find a variety of options for breakfast and lunch, each with a unique little twist.

It's hard to find Beach Cafe, as it's behind the gas station in a tiny shopping center.

Been living around this place for several years and never noticed it until I saw a small sign on the side of the road that caught my eye. Well, even with the sign just a block away pointing to the shop, it was blocked by another building that made it difficult to spot, going south on Jones blvd.

Disappointing orders:

Eggs Benedict: A pretty straightforward dish that consists of english muffin, layered with a slice of canadian bacon/ham, poached egg and the most important - hollandiase sauce. What would make or break the dish would certainly be the hollandaise sauce. Well, from experience with more than a handful of different versions of "eggs benedict" dishes I've had in the past, their sauce wasn't great or even good in my opinion. The home fried potatoes weren't any better..

Ortega Burger: Came with chili, grilled onions, pepper jack cheese and jalapeno mayonnaise. I didn't think I could've gone wrong with this one but it wasn't nearly as satisfying as the description. The meat was on the dry side, the chili was blah and I didn't notice anything special with their jalapeno mayo spread. Fries were fine, better than anything else offered this morning. I'd rather have Carl's Jr's.  "Santa Fe" Chicken sandwich over this any day.

Service was great, prices weren't good for quality nor quantity, decor was island casual and food was lacking in all aspects

This place was alright.. I had the breakfast sliders which were good, but not amazing!! The turn off for me was the lack of customer service. The servers were too busy doing prep work to check on us. I mean it's hard not to watch them since the kitchen is completely open. If I didn't have egg works or cracked egg I would come here. It is a little hard to find as it is hidden by a gas station,

Maybe I'll give them another try one day.

I usually don't ever complain but this place is seriously slow I didn't get my food for over an hour and it honestly wasn't that good. I bet they have some good stuff but the eggs florentine tastes like water and the wait was just not worth it.
service is always great and the food is always good. always love coming on weekends after a really busy week
This is my go to place in the neighborhood. I love family run businesses. Obviously so does the rest of the neighborhood because they are always busy. The breakfast burrito is my fav.

This place is cute, swimsuits hang above in surf style decor. With so many menu options from breakfast to burgers you are sure to have a hard time deciding. I stick to my favorite fish tacos.  This is a great local joint , be aware they close early on weekends.

I found this joint when I had a meal at Tonkatsu Kiyoshi which is basically next door so I finally decided to try this place out.
This is another place where my feelings are very mixed. It's more like 3.5 stars for me.
Inside, the place seems like a basic cafeteria with some beach decorations. They have your typical "mellow music" playing as well. I know it's supposed to be relaxing but the place was a bit too sleepy for me. That being said, the patrons that were there were clearly regulars so they must be doing something right.
Service was... ok. They weren't really that attentive to me, however that being said, it did look like all of them were pretty busy doing things such as putting things away, cleaning, restocking, etc. so at least it wasn't because they were just slacking off on the job.
Food was good but nothing really special. It also took a little long to come out. They do look like they have a lot of tasty brunch items. I like the fun facts that you can read on the back on the menu while you are waiting for your food. They only open until 3pm, so get your brunch fix in before then.
Took about an hour for my food to be delivered, and was pretty cold. The toast was burnt and hash browns were underdone. Pretty disappointed because I was starving :(

I loooooove Cap'n Crunch French Toast from the secret menu! 

This place certainly reminds me of Southern California and the little family run beach cafs that make up to coast. I like that feeling of knowing the owners and knowing it's family run. Very laid back and cool - SoCal. But that laid back also goes for the service which is a bit slow. I guess it matches the vibe there - laid back. 

But don't be fooled! The food speaks for itself and it is loaded with flavor. Everything I have tried is delicious - French toast to Cobb salad - which was great! There was tons of goodies on that thing.  I've had chicken tenders for kids - can't mess those up! Like I said I really enjoy it here and can put up with the slow service for the good prices and great food.

Food was decent, service was terrible. 

Me: Do you have good service?
We don't have that! *Jamaican Accent*

Pretty sure we were at the cafe for two hours for breakfast. Food was slow to come up, service was so slow. Got the bill and stood at the register while both servers walked by multiple times. Would not come back based on the service.

Me: Do you have a reliable server?
We don't have that! * Jamaican Accent*

I should know better and to read Yelp reviews first! I am in the habit of wanting to post positive reviews for a place, not negative ones.

I ordered from here via Uber Eats because I had a busy work-from-home morning, and it was first on the list. I ordered the California Benedict and the French Toast. The latter was solid. The former, however, had one completely overcooked egg (including a photo) AND one poached (still a bit overcooked) but with eggshell!

Now, I wasn't planning on posting at that point. Just wanted to call the restaurant and let them know about their mistake so they won't do it to someone else. 

Made the call, put on hold because busy. No problem. Told hostess who picked up who then got the manager. I tell her what I just told ya'll: overcooked eggs, eggshell. 

Manager (in dismissive tone): "We don't give refunds, go back to Uber Eats"
Me: "Um, that's not even why I'm calling. I just want to let you know so it doesn't happen again. Maybe let the cook know?"
Manager: "..."

That was it! 
No taking of responsibility, no "I'm so sorry!"
No "What can we do for you?"
No offering of an action to take to do better next time. 

THAT is when I decided to write this. That kind of attitude is not conducive whatsoever. Mistakes happen. I can forgive that. Being dismissive when you are caught in a mistake in managing a business like this is problematic. 

Never again. Do better, please.
We really enjoy the Beach, use the loyalty card for free meals, and try to go for the lobster Benny when it's on special!

This place was so cute and the food was really simple and great taste too. I am  going to go back for sure. While you are inside this place, you feel like you are away from Vegas(which is a good thing if you live in Vegas).

I love the food, great mom and pop (get the punch card).

The only hang up is that the meals take a bit to be made.
I ordered from here using Uber eats. I got a sandwich and a smoothie. My food was delicious and convenient! I definitely recommend this place!

I order from this place all the time and there have been a few times where my order was wrong and I'm not sure who was working at that time but they were very nice and very accommodating! They had one of their guys bring me my correct order. Today I place an order and they forgot one of my items so I called to see if there was anything they can do seeing as how it is their fault that the item is missing because they weren't paying attention. The girl on the phone had a nasty attitude, told me why am I mad at them and with a pissy attitude demanded I call UberEATS. Now as a person who is in customer service I would have done my best to accommodate the customer considering it was our fault who forgot to give the Uber driver the missing item not UberEATS fault!

I've been ordering from Beach Cafe for the last year and a half. I've only ordered breakfast meals from here and have never been disappointed. They are my number 1 choice for delivery  because they get the order right every time and they get it to me in less time than promised everytime!!! Cali Bene is my favorite and as far as their meals go they're by far the best value in the southwest part of the valley. Will continue to choose beach cafe as my first choice breakfast spot.

Ambiance = excellent
Food = excellent
Service = excellent

So what's not to love?  Nothing!!

Go grab some grub and imagine yourself on the beach and as the say "life's good at the beach!"

I've been a long time customer of the cafe and have had their delivery and dined in before.

The Food : The food is pretty good, I've never had a bad meal here. The specialty drinks are pretty good too. You really can't go wrong on the menu. 

The Service: Absolutely horrible. We order food from them a few times a week so we give them pretty good business. We always tip their drivers out nicely too. Be aware you are going to wait at least an hour-hour 30mins for delivery. The dine-in service always was bad, drinks never refilled in time, the girl would forget things. Not to mention the seating is the most uncomfortable ever. So after 3-4 trips we refrain from visiting here for Dine-in. 

They have forgotten stuff on delivery several times, and when you call they get all defensive about it, second guess you, call you a liar and they definitely don't apologize for their mistakes and on top of it, they don't try to make it up to you. In our business if we don't keep our customers happy, they leave and go somewhere else. I think we really need start looking for someone else to service our breakfast/lunch needs in the area.
Food was okay, it was not bad, waitress was good and friendly, ambiance was amazing, decorations are really great definitely a different place. It's worth checking out

Love, love the family friendly aspect of this spot. My son always asks to go to Beach Cafe. It's pretty close to our house so we do frequent this place from time to time. 

The decor is cute with swimsuits hanging from the ceiling. Beach boards and items all around and even more so the vibe of relaxation. 

We rode our bikes since its not too far, enjoyed some yummy breakfast then worked off the calories on our bike ride home. Calories sooooo worth it. We enjoyed some amazing and fluffy French toast with some crisp bacon and sausage, and scrumptious Cali benedict. 

We will be back for more reasons than the great food.
Food was great but we had to wait for a long while before we got to order. Service sucks

Service was excellent!! I ordered delivery of 3 different breakfast sandwiches, a macchiato, a frappucino, and muffins. ALL were amazing and perfect temperature. Definitely will be ordering from here again as I am picky with my breakfast, especially delivery. My food arrived in less than 45 minutes with an exceptional and respectful delivery

What better way to spend your New Years day but at a cozy little breakfast joint. OK, so it was a bit past noon before we made it there, but still...

Nestled inside of one of Las Vegas's notorious strip malls right between a gas station and bar, this nifty little eatery was a decent find.

The service standards in this town have declined so poorly that most dining experiences are a let down when it comes to great customer service. With that being said, the service at Beach Cafe was just that: mediocre.

The name of the restaurant, Beach Cafe, is exactly what it is: an island themed eatery complete with bathing suits hanging from the ceiling. 

Our very friendly waitress (insert sarcasm here) took our orders and shortly thereafter our food and beverages arrived.  My eggs, potato's and pancakes were delicious, and the orange juice and coffee weren't bad either.  But if you're super thirsty you might be waiting a while for a refill, if you are even asked if you'd like a refill at all. 

I love the idea of supporting local businesses so I would most certainly eat at Beach Cafe again should I end up in that area.  Though the service was not spectacular (the norm for most establishments these days), it's fine eats for breakfast!

I've gone here twice, both times for breakfast. Not once have we ordered something we didn't love.

On the first visit:
I ordered French toast ($6.25). The service size was big. (3 thick slices of french toast). You have the option to add bacon or sausage for $2 more, but unless you're hungry or love bacon, you don't need to.

My wife ordered the Cale Bene Eggs Benedict ($8.75). She was very satisfied.

On the second visit:
I ordered, what has now become, the best biscuits and gravy ($4.25) I've ever had (used to be the B&G at the free breakfast for guests of the Abby Inn in Cedar City, UT). You get 4 melt-in-your-mouth biscuits, with a perfectly peppered meaty gravy. For $3 mor, you get 2 eggs + bacon or sausage.

My wife got the Surf's Up Veggie Scramble ($7.95). She couldn't finish it all due to the serving size.

Plus they have free WiFi which was nice so I can follow my Fantasy Football team on my iPod touch.

Good food, cute place.
Love their tropical iced tea and their sliders with caramelized onions!
Like their fries especially when they're well done. Nice staff. 
Good specials. I like their lunch menu with several different options. 
Place is a little hidden so look for it.
The salads and sandwiches are pretty fresh n good. They have a great smoothie selection too!
I order from here often. always amazing. I get the Asian salad and it's so yum. their burgers are also great. my office also orders from here often on days we can not leave for lunch.

This place was great! It took a while for the food to come out but it was worth the wait. I got the mini breakfast sliders, sooo good! Also tried the Jamaican Me Crazy smoothie & that was really good too! Not too sweet. Prices are really good here too. Didn't feel like I was paying "Vegas prices" & definitely got my monies worth. Give it a try!!
Service sucks. Hot inside. Waitress sees me turning around looking for someone to refill my drink and still doesn't come. Service is a must for me. I'm not coming back here.

I just happened to find this place on Yelp and I can't believe that Beach Cafe has been open for six years, and it's a punt away from my house. Exceptional food and service and I'm now visiting weekly.
The menu has a lot to offer, and the food is very good. I highly recommend the ice cream mocha!

No Hello. Ok food. Not one smile. Asked for water 3 times. Unwelcoming.  This was my second visit thinking the first experience would be different. It was worse. The woman that served my family and i got a $1 tip on a $40 bill. I dont do that to people but i felt the need to return the disdain.

Great little, FAMILY FRIENDLY cafe.  I went for brunch with friends and their kids.  I must say, not every place is family friendly these days.

Everything on their menu looked good, but I opted for the Sunset Beach Scramble.  It was the perfect portion size with the eggs, potatoes and toast. Everything is pretty much as it is described in their menu.  No surprises.

Good service and great prices, as well.

I am so happy that I found this place. I have ate here twice and the food is SO GOOD. I had a waffle with strawberries and cream...And a bacon cheeseburger with fries...both were YUMMY. I can't wait to try more of their specialties people rave about. Only gave it 4 stars because the delivery always take like 20 mins after the hr they said it would take.

I have been a loyal customer for three years. I called today for delivery. After an hour I called to check up on the order. The owner was frazzled and condescending.  I said, "Please don't condescend me. I have I right to call and check up. I get that your slammed. I have a business too. "

Her response was incredibly odd. "No, this is my business. I will cancel the order and never order from here again. Then she hung-up."

I have my own business that has survived and thrived in Vegas for 27 years.We do 250+ events a year and 6000 daily deliveries. I am speaking from experience.

 When a small Mom and Pop operation is blessed enough to experience a rush;

1.  It is the RESPONSIBILITY of the owners to properly staff themselves.

2. Maintain prompt and courtesy service to their customers.

3. Remember how they got there (and this is ia SMALL operation and pretty pathetic that they can't handle a Sunday morning delivery by noon) is through repeat customers.

Here's how I tried to help their business..

1.  I have referred this restaurant through my own business as a caterer for countless weddings and events. 

2.  I have passed out their cards at my shop located on off the strip. 

3.  I have verbally endorsed them throughout my social circle. I

I really routed for this place in this economy. When my family has been in town I have taken them there and introduced the to the owners and staff.My support is withdrawn.
Delivery at work for breakfast and lunch . Great Greek Isle Scramble. And the Ruben, yassss!

I can't believe anyone has ever given a negative review of Beach Cafe.  It is without a doubt my favorite local breakfast spot.  You can keep your trendy eggworks and all those overrated places, I'll take Beach Cafe any day of the week.  The food is always delicious and fresh.  I suggest the breakfast scrambles or sandwiches.  Weekly specials are innovative and I haven't found any other place that serves Captain Crunch french toast.

For all you cheap people out there that don't like to spend money on going out to eat; first off, you are annoying and second this place is right up your alley.  It's not expensive.  If you think it, you have issues.  Food is rarely more than $8 so don't let cost deter you from coming in.  Furthermore they have a frequent diner stamp card so after 10 meals, you get one free. 

The coffee is excellent and so are there vanilla creamers!  They also have excellent passion ice tea.  The staff and servers are also wonderful.  Again, I'm not sure why there are bad reviews of the service here.  I've had nothing but wonderful experiences.  You are not treated like a random patron, they treat you like family here.  I don't even need to order, they always remember what I like.  I even get secret menu hash browns sometimes.  

The dining area is always clean, and there is a nice little bar area complete with a TV to watch my fantasy football team get destroyed on Sundays.  I don't just give out 5 star reviews on yelp, you have to earn it; and Beach Cafe definitely did.  It is by far; the best breakfast spot in the SW part of town.  Do yourself a favor and try it.

I am a new customer of Beach Cafe, but now I am eating their for breakfast at least once a week! 

The staff is always friendly, and seem to have a relationship with the regulars.  But how I judge a place is by the size of their drinks, and specifically the to-go cups! 

AMAZING size of to-go cups and the tropical tea is amazing!
If I could give 12 stars - I would. Hands down the best food, service and casual atmosphere in Vegas. Easily one of my top 3 favorite places in town.

The pancakes were great, and the scrambles are awesome.  It took forever to get my order and I'm not sure it was a Grub Hub glitch or theirs but  it was worth the wait. I have found my new breakfast spot and I plan to be a regular customer.

I walked in and experienced the same thing Raymond B. did: stood in the middle of the room and looked like a lost sheep. After a minute of deciding I didn't have time to wait around, I sat at a table in the corner.  After no one even looked my way for about 5 minutes, I thought, "Okay, maybe this is an order-at-the-counter kind of place". So I walked up to the counter and asked if I could order. The lady at the counter seemed sincerely surprised that I was there, and said I could take a seat as she called the waitress over. The waitress apologized for the wait and after that bumpy start, service was fast and friendly.

I was dying for a smoothie and realized that they had all the tropical flavors I loved, so I ordered the Hawaiian cooler. I didn't realize that they didn't use fresh fruits, like I was expecting, but the smoothie was tasty nonetheless. A little on the sweet side for my tastes since they use fruit juices from the box, but with a little water mixed in it was fine. 

I had the fish tacos, which had fried pollock according to the menu, and they were really, really delicious. My only gripe about it is the salsa. I prefer a salsa verde with fish tacos because I think the tomatillo is a better complement for fish, but they didn't exactly have a salsa bar going so I didn't ask them about it. If they had at least 1 other salsa option that wasn't red and didn't taste like something pre-made, I think I'd definitely say these would be my most favorite fish tacos in town. Also, I thought they would come with tortilla chips, but they didn't and normally this would be a huge no-no for me but the order actually came with 3 really yummy tacos so that was more than enough to fill me up. 

I'm excited to come back and try their breakfast menu because... well, because I really freaking love breakfast food. Also, the sandwiches on their menu looked really good too.
Excellent food! Everything is delicious and cooked well!. Not overly greasy like a lot of breakfast places. Awesome breakfast place!
Awesome local cafe...love the breakfast skillets. Whenever I am back in Vegas I am sure to visit.  Great menu, friendly wait staff, and fun beach atmosphere.

Cute little place, large portions, excellent food.

Very slow service.  We were there for breakfast and they were already working on takeout orders.  Sadly, they took more time with them and put us in the background.

I don't like coffee, but I had a cup that was quite good.  Our sweet waitress made me steamed milk to make it more acceptable for me.  thank you!

The owner is very nice.  We chatted for a bit.

We didn't get an opportunity to eat here because we had to leave due to the service being slow. We came in at 7:15am to eat breakfast, we were here before work so we had about 40mins we could spend here. At 7:30 our order was taken but the cook was doing some sort of inventory so our food wasn't going to be getting prepared for some time. We asked them to cancel their order and said thank you and the woman upfront just ignored me. I was at no point being rude with her but she felt the need to be dismissive towards me. She didn't even great us when we walked in, they actually looked at us shocked that someone would come in within their business hours.

I pretty much only shop local and if I can't shop local I at least purchase products manufactured in the U.S.A.  It's a real shame to me when I go to try a new LOCAL place and the service is that bad, I know we weren't there for that long, but you can tell right when you walk into a place how the service is going to be by how you're greeted or lack there of.  I wish I had an opportunity to try their food, had they been more focused on the customer and not on inventory that should have been completed prior to opening then I'd probably be writing a different review right now.
We ordered in breakfast and it was a true delight. We had tamales, burritos and the breakfast quesadilla. All were delicious. The OJ is fresh squeezed. Generous portions! Polite and kind service!

If that Beach burger wasnt SOOO GOOD!!

Customer service is out the window when it comes to this place. 

Sometimes bad enough to where I'd just rather go to the million other places that serve burgers just as good or better with even better customer service.

The food here was deeeelicious! I got the fish tacos and Lava Flow smoothie. The menu was full of unique looking foods and if I had the stomach capacity, I would've tried everything.

I can only give three stars though because of the service. The two girls that were working there seemed like they did not want to be there and were not afraid to show it. I'm glad my boyfriend and I got our food to go because I didn't want to be around them any longer.

It was 10 AM. And just less than a mile away from my home, Beach Cafe has truly hit me both its food and its scene. As soon as I walked in, not only I was welcomed, but I was hit full-on of nostalgia. As a former islander of 12 years from Hawaii, I was longing to find a new eatery, scenery, and grinds that will not only satisfy my longing stay in Vegas but at least make me feel welcomed as a new local. And, to my surprise, my new home has never felt so close when I first entered Beach Cafe. 

As soon as I sat, I looked into their menu right away. Ranging from scrambled eggs, south-of-the-border breakfasts, to benedicts and burgers, to pancakes, french toast, and waffles as well. But of course, I just had to take a look and feel the scenery, too. The vibe was great. The morning atmosphere truly does help represent the scene of a beach. But next is the food. 

My first order of course: coffee.  
It was fresh, no fancy gimmick, just classic. The overall result: sublime. 

Now, straight into the entre: The Surf's Up Veggie Scramble.
The eggs were fresh, smooth to chew along with yummy peppers blended with cheese, tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, all sauteed well within the eggs. The bread was perfectly toasted, the diced potatoes were cooked very well to the point that it's not hard but not too smooth to chew (Yes, I'm anal like that). The overall result: Seconds, please. I beg of you. 

Overall, the place was fantastic. I could stay there and have a relaxing read, or just stop by for a quick breakfast or brunch. They do delivery as well. But, just knowing the fact that this wonderful place is close by?

Well, let's just say, that I truly and finally feel at home. 

Now, if you'll excuse me, I must get back as I am starving for what they have in store.

P.S If you're jonesing for some desserts afterwards? I beg of you, try the Copa Banana. No regrets.

-AC

There's service not worth remembering, and then there is service so terrible you can't forget it...

I have never not tipped a a restaurant before, until now. I'm a server so I know how it goes. But I have never and would never give such terrible service to anyone. Working on the strip being slammed, dealing with drunk and obscene people I have not even treated them so poorly, yet for us being the only guests in the building? There is no excuse for not once saying, "You're welcome," after I say thank you multiple times upon receiving waters, food, the extra roll up we asked for, her taking our order... She just turned and walked away each time. The only time we received one was when she realized she forgot the smoothie my boyfriend ordered at the end of our meal and finally brought it over. We received no proper greeting, no social interactions, nothing... Not to mention when she finished taking our orders she just threw the menus on the table next to us and left them there. On top of it all she never even gave us her name. She was probably aware of her shit service and didn't want to risk being called out. 

On to the filthy restaurant and terrible health standards of our server. Upon walking in we immediately realized the floors and tables were disgusting. There was dirt and pieces of trash in the corners on the floor next to us. The manager along with our server and another employee were all handling a dog, which yeah not really okay to have the dog behind the bar but I would have let it slide had ANY of them bothered to wash their hands. Our server literally held the dog and was petting it, turned around; and grabbed the gravy I had asked for off the food window... Brought the gravy to me, bussed some plates, answered the phone, handled money, and put some items into a fridge all without once pausing to wash her hands. I was disgusted to the point where I debated even eating the food she brought to me. The other employee didn't even bother washing her hands after handing the dog off then going to portion ice cream.. Do they even have health cards? Working in the restaurant industry for the past almost 7 years now and attending culinary school, I cannot fathom how these two even managed to get hired at a restaurant. 

Here's to hoping the kitchen staff know what  health code is.

I've tried this place three times now and every visit there is something that's just not good. The sides have too much mayo, the food is over done, or there are strange unidentified pieces of stuff in the food. It's just tasteless poor quality.
Good food for good prices. Staff attentive and friendly, definitely deserves an extra tip.

Based on yelp reviews I went in for Capt Crunch French Toast. Exciting as it sounded it wasn't five stars but the server was very helpful and attentive so that makes a difference. The burger menu looks amazing so I will return for that. Good burgers are always a plus.

3 star because the service and food quality could be better.

Not one of the bad reviews has a response from the owner. That isn't good. 

I have ordered from here about 10 times using amazon delivery and most the time the food is decent. Amazon service is good but the food prep was lacking sometimes. 

Fruit was small, didn't seem very fresh, and gave a lot of hard pieces of melon. They should use something to wrap the breakfast sandwich to hold the stuff in place because sometimes the cheese is only covering half and stuff was falling out.

The other thing is they send advertising for grubhub when I ordered on amazon. Showing total disrespect to the company that brought you the 10+ orders I've gave you just shows again the disrespect they have for others. 

I wanted to give at least a 4 but I know my concerns will go ignored like the other reviewers. 

Step it up Beach.

Ordered here today via Eat24. It said it would be a 75 minute delivery time but it came in 45 which was nice. The food was warm and fresh. We order the chicken fingers which were crunchy and juicy (the side of housemade ranch was perfect). The burger was cooked well and the toppings on it were fresh. We ordered their chili cheese fries and they were, by far, the best chili cheese fries ever, hands down. My only gripe is that the menu didn't specify that fries came with the burger and chicken fingers so we got a lot of fries and the majority of them went to waste. 

From the other reviews, I don't think I'd ever dine in just so my experience with this restaurant isn't ruined. I'd order delivery again though.

This is without a doubt the greatest menu in town. I sat there for 20 minutes because everything looked, sounded;  (and in prior visits), tasted so good...that I couldn't decide. It's fun, eclectic, fast, priced right and the owner is right there making sure everything is done the way it's supposed to be done. I like the Bagel Caf, but I LOVE the Beach Caf! After all, would I rather be waiting and jammed in "at" a Bagel, or would I rather be at Beach? It's a no brainer.

I enjoy their burgers n it's close to my house so I like stopping by n grab a quick lunch time to time but, i never felt welcome in this place servers seem to hang by the counter most of the time talk to the people they seem to know each other pretty well once I got my food she never came to check on me & never got my drink refilled or anything at all...since I'm in tipping industry too I still leave 20% tip every time but, not for the service I receive for the food only! And Vegas is 24/7 town n people work night shift don't get up til like 2p so, they should open til later closing @3p is ridiculous :(

Robyn at Beach Cafe was the most gracious and helpful owner/manager I could have ever asked for.  She went above and beyond during her busiest weekend breakfast hours to make and deliver 15 different entrees and beverages promptly three days in a row.  But get this.  Every single entree that my friends and family ordered claimed it was the best of that entree that they ever had.  Me personally, the California Benedict was the best breakfast I've ever had in general.  I hope they open one in Irvine where we are from :)

Service is ook, nice selection of food but the breakfast i had there twice was nothing to rave about. 

Their sandwiches are a better option imo. I will be updating my review once I try their sandwiches.

We were looking for a different place to eat breakfast and I happened to come across this cafe on here and decided to go. Delicious food! I got the tamale and egg, so good. The kids had a pancake which I ate most of. Staff was nice and attentive. I will definitely be back!

This place was awesome!!! I really enjoyed the beach cafe. Really warm welcome when I walked in. You can tell the staff cares about their customers. The food was delicious and the great service all around. They offer boxed lunches if you want to pick up on the way to work. I haven't tried that out but want to. They do catering. Definitely going to go back here!
i like their food, but man why have i been waiting for my takeout for an hour and a half?!?!  i call and they said its on their way....ummmm if you find me passed out at my desk jus call 911

Cowabunga dude......how else to start a review of a cafe called Beach.... So 9 am on a wednesday and its obvious at this time more orders out than inside diners ( they do a good catering business).  I really wish one was in my neighborhood as that may slow me down from coming here ( what a shame)  There is the swimming suits hanging that is to me the downfall as it appears to be a bit much, but as I always say... Its about the food.   Our normal party of 4.... The young one always has a waffle and side bacon but the other youngin had these breakfast sliders and mother had a breakfast croissant that she approves with crispy hash browns that were perfect..
